oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville Plow Works sword
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Confederate cavalry saber from Nashville Plow Works. The letters "CS" as well as "Nashville Plow Works" are cast on the brass guard. The sword belonged to Capt. William Oliver Bennett, Co. K, 1st Tenn. Cav. Regt., CSA, subsequently 6th Tenn. (Wheeler's); Cav. Bennett was born in the Bunker Hill community of Giles County on Dec. 22, 1834. He enlisted in Dec. of 1861 and served until he was discharged for disability in 1863. He married Ann Henry Nave on Feb. 7, 1867, in Giles County, and died Dec. 17, 1917.
